com.apptentive.android.sdk
Class Apptentive

java.lang.Object
  com.apptentive.android.sdk.Apptentive

public class Apptentive
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the complete API for accessing Apptentive features from within your app.

Method Detail

onStart

public static void onStart(android.app.Activity activity)
Call this method from each of your Activities' onStart() methods. Must be called before using other Apptentive APIs methods

Parameters:
activity - The Activity from which this method is called.

onStop

public static void onStop(android.app.Activity activity)
Call this method from each of your Activities' onStop() methods.

Parameters:
activity - The Activity from which this method is called.

setInitialUserEmail

public static void setInitialUserEmail(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.lang.String email)
Sets the initial user email address. This email address will be sent to the Apptentive server to allow out of app communication, and to help provide more context about this user. This email will be the definitive email address for this user, unless one is provided directly by the user through an Apptentive UI. Calls to this method are idempotent.

Parameters:
context - The context from which this method is called.
email - The user's email address.

setCustomDeviceData

public static void setCustomDeviceData(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customDeviceData)

Allows you to pass arbitrary string data to the server along with this device's info. This method will replace all custom device data that you have set for this app. Calls to this method are idempotent.

To add a single piece of custom device data, use addCustomDeviceData(android.content.Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

To remove a single piece of custom device data, use removeCustomDeviceData(android.content.Context, java.lang.String)

Parameters:
context - The context from which this method is called.
customDeviceData - A Map of key/value pairs to send to the server.

addCustomDeviceData

public static void addCustomDeviceData(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.lang.String key,
                                       java.lang.String value)
Add a piece of custom data to the device's info. This info will be sent to the server. Calls to this method are idempotent.

Parameters:
context - The context from which this method is called.
key - The key to store the data under.
value - The value of the data.

removeCustomDeviceData

public static void removeCustomDeviceData(android.content.Context context,
                                          java.lang.String key)
Remove a piece of custom data from the device's info. Calls to this method are idempotent.

Parameters:
context - The context from which this method is called.
key - The key to remove.

setCustomPersonData

public static void setCustomPersonData(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customPersonData)

Allows you to pass arbitrary string data to the server along with this person's info. This method will replace all custom person data that you have set for this app. Calls to this method are idempotent.

To add a single piece of custom person data, use addCustomPersonData(android.content.Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

To remove a single piece of custom person data, use removeCustomPersonData(android.content.Context, java.lang.String)

Parameters:
context - The context from which this method is called.
customPersonData - A Map of key/value pairs to send to the server.

Parameters:

addIntegration

public static void addIntegration(android.content.Context context,
                                  java.lang.String integration,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
Allows you to pass in third party integration details. Each integration that is supported at the time this version of the SDK is published is listed below.

  • Urban Airship push notifications

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method is called.
integration - The name of the integration. Integrations known at the time this SDK was released are listed below.
config - A String to String Map of key/value pairs representing all necessary configuration data Apptentive needs to use the specific third party integration.

addUrbanAirshipPushIntegration

public static void addUrbanAirshipPushIntegration(android.content.Context context,
                                                  java.lang.String apid)
Configures Apptentive to work with Urban Airship push notifications. You must first set up your app to work with Urban Airship to use this integration. This method must be called when you finish initializing Urban Airship. Since Urban Airship creates an APID after it connects to its server, the APID may be null at first. The preferred method of retrieving the APID is to listen to the PushManager.ACTION_REGISTRATION_FINISHED Intent in your BroadcastReceiver. You can alternately find the APID by calling PushManager.shared().getAPID()

Note: Initializing Urban Airship may take a few seconds. You may need to close and reopen the app in order to force the APID to be sent to our server. Push notifications will not be delivered to this app install until our server receives the APID.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method is called.
apid - The Airship Push ID (APID).

addAmazonSnsPushIntegration

public static void addAmazonSnsPushIntegration(android.content.Context context,
                                               java.lang.String registrationId)
Configures Apptentive to work with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Simple Notification Service (SNS) push notifications. You must first set up your app to work with AWS SNS to use this integration. This method must be called when you finish initializing AWS SNS using GoogleCloudMessaging.register(String... senderIds), which returns the Registration ID. You will need to pass this returned Registration ID into this method.

Note: You may need to close and reopen the app in order to force the Registration ID to be sent to our server. Push notifications will not be delivered to this app install until our server receives the Registration ID.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method was called.
registrationId - The registrationId returned from GoogleCloudMessaging.register(String... senderIds).

setPendingPushNotification

public static void setPendingPushNotification(android.content.Context context,
                                              android.content.Intent intent)
Saves Apptentive specific data form a push notification Intent. In your BroadcastReceiver, if the push notification came from Apptentive, it will have data that needs to be saved before you launch your Activity. You must call this method every time you get a push opened Intent, and before you launch your Activity. If the push notification did not come from Apptentive, this method has no effect.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method is called.
intent - The Intent that you received when the user opened a push notification.

handleOpenedPushNotification

public static boolean handleOpenedPushNotification(android.app.Activity activity)
Launches Apptentive features based on a push notification Intent. Before you call this, you must call setPendingPushNotification(Context, Intent) in your Broadcast receiver when a push notification is opened by the user. Call this method must be called from the Activity that you launched from the BroadcastReceiver. This method will only handle Apptentive originated push notifications, so call is anytime you receive a push.

Parameters:
activity - The Activity from which this method is called.
Returns:
True if a call to this method resulted in Apptentive displaying a View.

isApptentivePushNotification

public static boolean isApptentivePushNotification(android.content.Intent intent)
Determines whether a push was sent by Apptentive. Apptentive push notifications will result in an Intent containing a string extra key of APPTENTIVE_PUSH_EXTRA_KEY.

Parameters:
intent - The push notification Intent you received in your BroadcastReceiver.
Returns:
True if the Intent contains Apptentive push information.

setRatingProvider

public static void setRatingProvider(IRatingProvider ratingProvider)
Use this to choose where to send the user when they are prompted to rate the app. This should be the same place that the app was downloaded from.

Parameters:
ratingProvider - A IRatingProvider value.

putRatingProviderArg

public static void putRatingProviderArg(java.lang.String key,
                                        java.lang.String value)
If there are any properties that your IRatingProvider implementation requires, populate them here. This is not currently needed with the Google Play and Amazon Appstore IRatingProviders.

Parameters:
key - A String
value - A String

showMessageCenter

public static void showMessageCenter(android.app.Activity activity)
Opens the Apptentive Message Center UI Activity

Parameters:
activity - The Activity from which to launch the Message Center

showMessageCenter

public static void showMessageCenter(android.app.Activity activity,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customData)
Opens the Apptentive Message Center UI Activity, and allows custom data to be sent with the next message the user sends. If the user sends multiple messages, this data will only be sent with the first message sent after this method is invoked. Additional invocations of this method with custom data will repeat this process.

Parameters:
activity - The Activity from which to launch the Message Center
customData - A Map of key/value Strings that will be sent with the next message.

setUnreadMessagesListener

public static void setUnreadMessagesListener(UnreadMessagesListener listener)
Set a listener to be notified when the number of unread messages in the Message Center changes.

Parameters:
listener - An UnreadMessageListener that you instantiate.

getUnreadMessageCount

public static int getUnreadMessageCount(android.content.Context context)
Returns the number of unread messages in the Message Center.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method is called.
Returns:
The number of unread messages.

sendAttachmentText

public static void sendAttachmentText(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.lang.String text)
Sends a text message to the server. This message will be visible in the conversation view on the server, but will not be shown in the client's Message Center.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method is called.
text - The message you wish to send.

sendAttachmentFile

public static void sendAttachmentFile(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.lang.String uri)
Sends a file to the server. This file will be visible in the conversation view on the server, but will not be shown in the client's Message Center. A local copy of this file will be made until the message is transmitted, at which point the temporary file will be deleted.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method was called.
uri - The URI of the local resource file.

sendAttachmentFile

public static void sendAttachmentFile(android.content.Context context,
                                      byte[] content,
                                      java.lang.String mimeType)
Sends a file to the server. This file will be visible in the conversation view on the server, but will not be shown in the client's Message Center. A local copy of this file will be made until the message is transmitted, at which point the temporary file will be deleted.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method was called.
content - A byte array of the file contents.
mimeType - The mime type of the file.

sendAttachmentFile

public static void sendAttachmentFile(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.io.InputStream is,
                                      java.lang.String mimeType)
Sends a file to the server. This file will be visible in the conversation view on the server, but will not be shown in the client's Message Center. A local copy of this file will be made until the message is transmitted, at which point the temporary file will be deleted.

Parameters:
context - The Context from which this method was called.
is - An InputStream from the desired file.
mimeType - The mime type of the file.

engage

public static boolean engage(android.app.Activity activity,
                             java.lang.String event)
This method takes a unique event string, stores a record of that event having been visited, figures out if there is an interaction that is able to run for this event, and then runs it. If more than one interaction can run, then the most appropriate interaction takes precedence. Only one interaction at most will run per invocation of this method.

Parameters:
activity - The Activity from which this method is called.
event - A unique String representing the line this method is called on. For instance, you may want to have the ability to target interactions to run after the user uploads a file in your app. You may then call engage(activity, "finished_upload");
Returns:
true if the an interaction was shown, else false.
